definition: first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: He is hitting the wire leader with his spear, he thought.
sentences.chinese: 它正用它的長嘴撞擊着鐵絲導線，他想。

sentences.english: She was braising beef in a covered pot.
sentences.chinese: 她正用一個蓋嚴的鍋燜牛肉。

sentences.english: The fish had slowed again and was going at his usual pace.
sentences.chinese: 魚又慢下來了，正用它慣常的速度遊着。

sentences.english: As the rocket sped toward Mulan and Shan-Yu, Mulan pinned Shan-Yu to the roof with his sword.
sentences.chinese: 火箭衝向屋頂上的木蘭和單與，木蘭正用劍指着單于。

sentences.english: The hunter is using his newly-bought pneumatic gun to shoot the birds.
sentences.chinese: 這個獵人正用他新買的氣槍來打鳥。

sentences.english: She was glowering at Carlisle with a resentful expression.
sentences.chinese: 她正用忿恨的神情瞪着卡萊爾。

sentences.english: He is cutting the branch es with a pair of shears.
sentences.chinese: 他正用一把大剪刀剪樹枝。

sentences.english: He poked the coals up into a blaze.
Servants were carrying great silver trays of party food and drinks.
sentences.chinese: 僕人們正用銀盤端着宴客的食物和飲料。

sentences.english: Wilbur was poking the straw with his snout.
sentences.chinese: 見威伯正用他的鼻子拱那些稻草。

sentences.english: She was noisily sucking up milk through a straw.
sentences.chinese: 她正用吸管咕嘟咕嘟地喝牛奶。

sentences.english: Too much public money is going on the wrong things.
sentences.chinese: 太多公款正用在錯誤的事情上。

sentences.english: Facer was skimming flat stones across the surface of the lake.
sentences.chinese: 費塞正用扁石子在湖面上打水漂。

sentences.english: Between the two trees, a man shoots an arrow at a bird on the tall tree.
sentences.chinese: 兩樹之間一人正用箭射下高樹上的一隻鳥。

sentences.english: Maria was talking baby talk to the little one.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗亞正用兒語和小傢伙說話。

definition: (out of) the corner of one's eyes/peripheral vision/residual light/light of the setting sun
unable to take one's eyes off (idiom); to gaze steadily/to stare
to size sb up/to look sb up and down/to take the measure of/to suppose/to reckon
